Reviews.Title: “Cold showers”
Reviews.Author: Skyrocketbilly
Reviews.Content: Room was fine, breakfast passable but cold showers make me think I will be going elsewhere should I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: nikkibarker
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5-8 of march. Had a large room we never went hungry for breakfast.great location.staff could of been a bit more friendly.but we really enjoyed our stay and would defo go again.it was a budget break and thats what we got. the safe in room was a nice touch.i had read the reviews before i went and was worrried but our stay was great. Will defo use this hotel again x

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small but comfortable rooms, average service.”
Reviews.Author: CarlosBrighton
Reviews.Content: I booked in via an agent, and there was some hoo ha as we when we got there they could not find our reservation causing some concern. Then they showed us to a room that had not been tidied and the bed remained unmade??!!! But overall, they were small, quiet and comfortable rooms, and reasonable for the price. The breakfast was a continental breakfast, and it was a good location for the museums, Vogelpark, and trams into town. So overall, I think I would use them again, but it's nowt fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Extremley Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: RobL101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here beginning of July when attending the White Sensation party at the Arena. Paid Â£270 for 2 nights , an utterly exorbitant price for 2 nights in this hotel. Very average and an extremley dated hotel. One of the men working at the front desk was border line obnoxious to boot. I paid extra for a late check out from my room as i had a late flight on the Sunday evening. Then on the day i was leaving i was told i had to vacate my room and move to another room to suit these guys. Obviosuly this was purely to suit their cleaning schedule. Not acceptable. I was locked out of a room with all my stuff during this changeover (completely hungover and tired) while i waited for the extremley rude man on desk to get me a working Door card. (Initial one did not work so i had to come all the way back down the lift and wait in reception while this was sorted. This took the guts of an hour for this imbicile to do. Will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bumped without warning”
Reviews.Author: PeterinUK
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Omega early in the morning from the ferry to drop off our bags. When we returned later in the afternoon to check in (we couldn't check in earlier), we were told we had been bumped to another hotel. No apologies, and when offered a room at the Omega to share between three (as opposed to the two rooms we had booked and paid for), we were offered only a 25% reduction in charges. We were told the sister Hotel Belfort was just a good (which if you see the reviews of the Belfort you'll see is not a positive), and was just as close to the centre (which wasn't true). Even if we had been given rooms, we'd have been disappointed as the hotel was undergoing substantial renovations which meant a stay would not have been very pleasant. I cannot comment on the quality of the rooms, as we never saw them. But the service culture was non existent.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive!”
Reviews.Author: oberd2000
Reviews.Content: The room was not very big and dusty (telephone, TV, mirror, pictures). 2 lamps beside my bed did not work. They could repair one. Bad lightning in general. Tiny bathroom (when I bent to the wash-basin, I burned my backside at the heater). The breakfast was rather poor (very good coffee, but only one type of sausage, one type of cheese, green scrambled eggs, bacon and hot sausages, cornflakes, jam and 3 types of juice). The plus of this hotel is the very friendly stuff, that it was very quiet and that it is situated in a very nice region (near the Vondel Park, the Concertgebouw and the big museums) For 180.--â‚¬ a night it was too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: AmbushStockport
Reviews.Content: The Omega Hotel is in a really good location for the Museums and picking up the tram to get into the centre of the city. The Hotel itself is an average Hotel, the room we had was large enough but it could have been cleaner and definitely needed a lick of paint as it looked tired and shabby. Having said that, the bed was comfortable (but not the pillows these were rock hard and not good for sleeping on) and the shower was hot. The staff at the Hotel were polite and helpful and let us leave our bags in the reception area until we were ready to pick them up late afternoon. The breakfast room was not very inspiring, dark tables and chairs it reminded me of my old refectory at school, although the breakfast items were okay, bread, croissants, jams, cheese and ham, but avoid the scrambled eggs and sausages, just awful. Oh, and one thing to mention is the church clock which chimes every half an hour, it added something to the stay but not to your sleep. Would not stay at this Hotel again but certainly would stay in the area which was lovely. For nice food and drink and a very cheery welcome try Gruter Bar just round the corner right by the tram stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: chrisjie
Reviews.Content: The rooms were small but clean. The breakfast was acceptable and the location is really good. It's right near a tram line and within walking distance of museums and restaurants. It's away from the hustle and bustle of the centre, but close to museums/parks/restaurants. There's also a tram right nearby that takes you right into town and/or the train station. People have complained about the service/condition of the hotel, but for the price I found it very reasonable compared to everything else in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small room, breakfast in the garden and problem with internet connection”
Reviews.Author: ievaliene
Reviews.Content: + Hotel had a good location - close to main attractions (Leidseplain, Vondelpark), but in the same time in a quiet place, close to a tram stop, which went right to the Central Station. + Bells of a church didn't disturb us, because the church was under reconstruction. + Staff were polite. We hadn't problems, which staff had to solve. + Breakfast buffett was not very wide, but we always went for breaksfast in the last minute before closing. + There was nice garden, where I meet cat, who loved my breakfast cheese. :) + / - Room (double) was small, expecialy shower/ WC room, but it was clean and comfortable, with good heating. Some lamps were out of order. - There was problem with internet connenction in the mornings and evenings. Overall I recommend this hotel for those, who are searcing good and cheap hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Far away from most attractions, bad service, bad Internet connection - decent breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: NYpizzayum
Reviews.Content: This hotel is mostly clean, but very shabby. Could use a serious facelift. Seemed a bit shady. Some said it added to charm, but to others it was not nice to come home to after a long day of sightseeing. Good thing was that it was on a quiet and fairly calm street. It is about a 10 minute walk to the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijks Museum, but there are tram stops within a 3 minute walk in both directions. To get into the main center it is about a 15-20 minute tram ride. Vondelpark is very close and is a nice experience for morning runs and/or bike rides. The Blauwe Theehuis inside the park is a great local spot and great for people watching. Another plus, Omega is right across the street from the oldest and most celebrated pizzeria in Amsterdam. You won't see many tourists here - just locals and regulars. Internet was a major problem. We were expecting to be able to make use of the free wifi to make our routes for the day on Google Maps (synchronized with the public transport system), but instead we were severely handicapped by extremely slow speeds and bad signals. Sometimes we did not have any internet at all. Overall, I would have opted to stay at one of the Conscious Hotels or further in the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam great city : great people.”
Reviews.Author: shamrocks_11
Reviews.Content: Omega Hotel does not warrent 3** hotel status. A 2** boarding house mark would be closer to the mark. A lick of paint, new carpeting and furniture here and there would not go amiss. On arrival we found our room safe didn't work. Turned out that it needed battery replacement. Happens that another guest experienced an identical problem!!! Maybe the Omega's normal clientele are not room safe users. Or is it that Management is not over- attentive to customer expectations? A bit of both... I suspect. On the plus side, the No 2 tram stop is conveniently close by.. And our day started off with a hot buffet style breakfast with, to my taste,excellently flavoured grilled bacon.

Reviews.Title: “An nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: tony789
Reviews.Content: We asked for early check in and thats what we got, after reading the reviews we were alittle unsure however we found very little problems we went to the bar a number of time late on the night and got servied (people state there wont serive you) we asked for a map and got a map, we stayed in two room 1 room heating was not working however we did not have a problem with this as the weather was rather hot so did not complain about this. You do not go away to sit and pick faults from hotels it just somewere to sleep on night and i would happley stay here again it is a really cheap hotel which it clean and close to the tram station with a good selection of shops close by including Mcdonalds and coffeshops. For red light/center just get an a tram which goes that way and ask for an 1 hour pass (2.60) or a day pass (7.00) be fast when the trams stop there dont wait

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hospitable service”
Reviews.Author: debsi
Reviews.Content: We've been to Amsterdam many times and found the Omega hotel five years ago. It's been through many owners and ups and downs. The current owners have really improved the service and cleanliness of the hotel. We travel for business and the Wifi connection was working sporadically. The new owner Tiko ensured it would be working and so it was. Having a Wifi connection was a crucial factor for our stay in Amsterdam. The hotel is around the corner from Museumplein and the Concert Hall. Vondelpark is a 2 minute walk away and wonderfull all times the year. The breakfast is adequate and the staff is extremely helpful. The 2 and 16 trams take you all major attractions within 10 minutes and the 5 takes you to the large indoor shopping mall in Amstelveen.

Reviews.Title: “Good and clean 3* hotel close to musuem square and with convinient transportation :) Go”
Reviews.Author: Tina_Athens_Greece
Reviews.Content: +Location: Very close to the museum square +2 Tram stops very close to the hotel with direct connection to all the main attractions and the central station +Very clean room, toilet and linens. +Very good heating +Satisfactory breakfast -Small rooms that were ok for us :D I am just 1.60!!! -TV remote control was not working in our room but we didn't care much because we didn't spend much time in the hotel asleep -internet in the lobby costs 3 euros / hour. Not too expensive but normally it is for free. By the way, I didn't hear any church bell

Reviews.Title: “Omega is not the last word (letter) in comfort and class.”
Reviews.Author: alexandercara
Reviews.Content: If you book the Omega Hotel be sure to specify a LARGE room, some of the smaller twin rooms have liittle space for comfortable movement. (We changed after the first night). The staffing and service is haphazard at best and coming in at about 9pm we found the bar closed but were told that if we went into the kitchen we could make our own tea. There are no drink making facilities in the bedrooms and our wardrobe had only one clothes hanger. If you want to 'doss down' for a couple of nights it isn't bad BUT don't expect luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: strongy39
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends for weekend and we were all very happy with the Omega. Did not come across the problems described in previous reviews. Breakfast was good, rooms small but very nice and comfortable. Location is excellent. staff very polite and friendly. Would definately look to see if the Omega had rooms if travelling to amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Tazcharlie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omega for two nights to celebrate my 40th birthday. The room we stayed in was overlooking the rear garden therefore the church bells did not bother us. It was a bit dated and shabby but for 2 nights only, it was adequate. The staff were not very friendly and it was an effort for them to open two bottle tops and take our money albeit before 12am. Do not book breakfast!! We had to eat out after attempting the breakfast as it was not worth the money at all. We were informed that the shuttle bus to the airport from the airport was 13.50 euros - in actual fact it is 15 euros per person so make sure you have the extra cash. The Omega is in an ideal spot - just out of the main city but close enough to walk and the tram stop is about a 2 minute walk. If you are looking for somewhere cheap for a short stay and are not fussed about the decor or the hospitality then this place is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: mikeyandfiona
Reviews.Content: On our stay we found the staff fairly welcoming, polite and helpful all except the breakfast cook/cleaner (older blonde woman with glasses) who was very rude when we asked if there was more croissants coming out. This was our first trip to the Dam and with the directions given by reception we would have been lost. Luckily we found a map of the city at the door after being told there weren't any. The location wasn't bad If you have a map as you can get to the other end of the city in 30 mins walking - though be wary of the two way trams. Breakfast was fine for what you would expect, good options yet basic. Room was small but cosy and to be honest you dont go to Amsterdam to sit in the room at lengths. All in all we would recommend it but can see where other people may have had bad experiences. The church bells didn't effect us one bit, they added to the excitement of being in the city.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO TO THIS HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: bentley_hotelnyc
Reviews.Content: This is by far THE WORST hotel I and my girlfriend have ever stayed in. The staff would be a lot happier if they didnt have any guest !! the rudist people i have ever met!. The rooms are disgusting; the outer cusions and bed throws hadnt seen a washing machine since they enterd the hotel some years back, the towels had holes in and were covered in stains, the TV and surface areas were think with dust and the foor had never had a vacum cleaner over it. We asked for a double but wasnt given a twin where the beds were arranged in the shape of the letter L as the room was so tiny!. PLEASE PLEASE Ignore the positive comments to this hotel as it really is very very bad!!!!!! It will ruin your stay in amsterdamm!! Trust me!!

Reviews.Title: “Very small room and rude staff”
Reviews.Author: irishgirl052
Reviews.Content: Hotel was old and rooms very small, couldnt swing a cat in it. Breakfast was haphazard but girl serving was helpfull if a little slow and out of her depth with so many there. Cleaning staff came into room even though we had do not disturb sign on door. Came back to hotel at 9.30pm on the sunday night and was told bar was closed although it should have been open untill 12am and receptionist was rude. would not stay here again or recomend it to friends..

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel, right next to van gogh museum”
Reviews.Author: siobhanonthehill
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my parents who were visiting me in the Netherlands and was a little nervous after reading some of the reviews online. I went to see the hotel before booking and i was pleasantly surprised. It is in the oud zuid district of Amsterdam which is the best area and where you oftern see several famous people drinking coffee locally! It is about 100m from the beautful Vondelpark, which is nice for walking in summer. The number 2 tram goes straight from central station to the tram stop at the end of the road and the hotel is just one stop on the tram to the Museumsplein (van gogh museum, rijksmuseum, concertgebouw etc). This hotel is perfect for couples/familys wanting to be in the centre of Amsterdam without being near the seedy red light district or near drunk and stoned tourists staggering home. The hotel itself is fine. Old 30's style decor, but the rooms are very warm (even when I visited in the snow and icey weather). The bathroom was a reasonable size with separate shower. My parents said that breakfast was fine, a lot of choice and was a decent start to the day and served between 7-10am. If you come in late you can make a cup of tea/coffee in the kitchen area without charge. The hotel has a small bar if you want a late night drink. The disadvantage is that there is a church opposite the hotel and the bells ring on the hour (and half hour) through the night, so if you are a light sleeper, try and get a room on the other side of the hotel or stay somewhere else. Another potential disadvantage (and something mentioned in several reviews) is that the breakfast does not run late at weekends, so if you are planning on hitting Amsterdam's vibrant party scene all night, then you may well miss breakfast! Also, I found that the family running the hotel are pleasant, the father seemed slightly grumpy, but the teenage children were very helpful. As somebody who lives in this country I was surprised with the negative reviews. Amsterdam is a capital city and if you want a modern hotel with modern decor, wifi and a pool in the centre of Amsterdam, then you have to be willing to pay for it. You get what you pay for with the Omega and if you want value then this is it. As somebody who lives in this country, i will definitely recommend Omega to my visitors who want to stay in Amsterdam for a few nights....

Reviews.Title: “Decent Value Hotel at City Center”
Reviews.Author: PVZ
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 people including 2 children (16y & 12y) stayed in this hotel for 3 days during Christmas holiday week. I did some research before our Europe trip, and read the reviews at this site. As usual, I pay more attention to the creditable posts (i.e. people with multiple reviews). I notice quite a few "noise" posts here (i.e. the people with no prior history posted single "noise" review). After some price comparison, I called the hotel directly, and they accepted the lowest price I found online. Pro: - Good location, walking distance to the museum district - Free breakfast buffet - lots of choices - Clean and comfortable room - Nice view, facing a large church - Friendly staff, provided good direction to the museums and the neighborhood - Decent value for the 3-star hotel Con: - â‚¬5 internet wi-fi fee. This seems normal in Europe, but it is usually free in the US. - Church bells ring at night, may be annoying to some. In general, we had a good stay in this hotel, and will definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here. Staff don't give a damn. Too noisey from adjacent church.”
Reviews.Author: CORIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Omega Hotel Amsterdam with my mother for 3 nights and it was the worse place we have ever stayed. The adjacent church did not let is sleep for the first night so we moved rooms. The sceond night checking in guests came into our room in the middle of the night as there was a mix up. The staff never apologised to us just passed the book. The staff were rude and unhelpful. There didn't seem to be any management.They ask you for cash preferably up front - that says alot about the place... I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A decent and relatively cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrksheep
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference in June 2009. I got a discount by prebooking on hotels.nl. Very good price for central Amsterdam. The room was a decent size, comfortable bed, clean en-suite shower and toilet, a mini-bar and air conditioning which came in handy as it was the middle of summer! A breakfast buffet is included in the price which is very generous, has lots of variety and very tasty. The staff were courteous and offered assistance when needed but were not overly friendly. Also the wi-fi was indicated as free on the website but actually costs â‚¬5 per 24 hours, which i couldn't use anyway because it doesn't extend to the top floor where i was staying. I had to use the wi-fi in the reception area which wasn't ideal. Also, I was on the side of the hotel facing a large church. While this makes for a very nice view, the church bells ring every half hour, through day AND night, which if you are a light sleeper can be a problem. Despite these minor problems, I had a pleasant stay here and would happily stay here again should I stay in Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay well clear of the place.....”
Reviews.Author: ZsaZsa23
Reviews.Content: We were moved into this hotel from Sander hotel as they apparently had broken toilets!! The Omega is an awful place, I shared a room with my friend. We stayed in attic room that you couldnt swing a cat in. The bed covers were disgusting - very stained. Breakfast was awful and on our last day there having booked a 2.43pm shuttle bus to airport - it never turned up and we ended up getting a taxi to airport. No apologies from the staff who were very rude. One piece of advice - NEVER STAY THERE!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a cheap, quiet weekend away”
Reviews.Author: grgwaldy
Reviews.Content: Having wanted a relaxing weekend away I was looking for a cheap, clean and a hotel instead of a hostel. The Omega hotel has a perfect balance. It's situated in a quiet residential area but there is a tram stop at the end of the road that goes past the city centre and straight to the railway station (No. 2 tram), or it's a fifteen minute walk to anywhere you may want to go. The museum district is a couple of minutes down the road and the park is a minute away. The hotel's location is a perfect balance. As for the rooms and service I was surprised how nice they are. simple, clean and comfy but with a worn old art deco style to the place. Nice breakfast, again simple but with some good variety. The staff that we dealt with were nice enough, but we didn't really need them much. If you want a nice play to stay, with a clean room and something to eat in the morning, for a very reasonable price. You won't do much better than this. If you want all the hotel trimmings and room service, pay for a large hotel, because you won't get that for this price. You pay for what you get. NB: It's only fair to mention the Church. Our room was on the fourth floor at the front, so as close to the bell tower as you can get. It rings out the hour during the day and evening, and one toll per half hour. It does stop during the night. You do get used to it very quickly, but if you are a light sleeper and go to bed early, it may be worth asking for a room at the rear.

Reviews.Title: “not so bad ... value for money!”
Reviews.Author: psychodoc
Reviews.Content: I travelled to amsterdam in may 2009 with a group of friends... well, after i saw some of the reviews here... i was a little scared about staying here, but the place was a surprise... it has a great location and has pretty big rooms. if you expect good room service then dont stay here but then the hotel says they are personal and homely... :). there was a problem with the bathroom when we checked in but it was immediately taken care of... whenever we needed something from the kitchen ... we could go there and use the microwave or the range ourselves. that wasnt so bad for us... as we would be out of the room for almost the whole day! have to say they dont have a lavish spread but the breakfast was good. we were happy... and the staff... unlike some other reviews... were very nice to us! hope this helps... ask me if you need more....

Reviews.Title: “not so bad....”
Reviews.Author: ciolla
Reviews.Content: We were there for 4 days....one staff member was rude, but the rest were very pleasant....it was clean, breakfast good, small hotel atmosphere.... close to museum, and not far from the city.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there”
Reviews.Author: Ilya1976
Reviews.Content: Hi, We stayed at hotel this month,. That was very dissapointed hotel. The room is very small. The location is far from the center. The staff never smiles. When we enter hotel, the reception men, met us without smile. He let us understand that he really doesnt have any mood to answer our questions. When my wife stuck with the luggage, he did not help here, despite he stand next to her. When we left he did not even say goodbye. Really , you should always check the hotel before order trip. Ilya

Reviews.Title: “do not stay there”
Reviews.Author: bidwap
Reviews.Content: myself and my partner stayed here last weekend, we were placed in a room with twin beds after booking a room with a double so we asked to be moved. The owner "mr personality" grunted at us and told us to go downstairs for the key. We entered the room to find it was half the size of the first room.the bar in the hotel had no staff, and again we had to ask the owner for some drinks again he grunted.the hotel website said it was close to the city centre, it took at least half an hour by tram and some walking to get to dam square.the hotel site also said they served hot and cold snacks,this was not the case.overall the experience was not great,i found the staff unhelpfull and quite rude.on the hotel sign outside it stated it was a 4 star hotel! it was barely a 2 star would definitely not reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Customer Service from Beginning til End with Luce the Manager”
Reviews.Author: Muchkin
Reviews.Content: From the minute I checked in I was greeted very warmly by a very handsome gentleman named Luce. He even upgraded my room at no charge! The room was warm and cozy and decorated very nicely. The room and bathroom were clean with extra toliet paper and a heating towel rack with plenty of towels! The breakfast was a full course of sausages, eggs, croisants, rolls, bread for making toast, an assortment of cheeses, cold meats, very good coffee, orange juice and a variety of cereals. The chef kept refilling everything for the guests and was friendly. The hotel was very close to the famous museums within walking distance of the hotel. The Tram from Central Staation (line #16) took be directly to the street, and it was a 5 minute walk to the hotel. There was an outstanding Italian Restaurant across the street where I ate for dinner twice, it was that delicious! There is a church across the street that has a bell tower and you should know that on the hour the bell rings the hour but uses restraint in the wee hours of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: breconbeacons
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it has a lift, and my mother-in-law has trouble with stairs. But of the 3 rooms we got, only 1 didn't involve stairs (#43). However, this had twin beds arranged in an L, so I don't recommend it for a romantic getaway. #27 had stairs inside the room to get to the bed level, and #67 involved several steps down, then several more back up, without a railing (of course this was the single my mother-in-law got). But the real issue was the service. Got in before 14:00 (check-in) and were told nothing would be ready until 14:00. When we got back a little before 14:00, only one room was ready. We sat in the reception area waiting for the others. The person at reception went into a back room and didn't come out to tell us when the second room was ready - we had to go back and ask him. Still waiting for the 3rd room at 14:20, when we see the cleaning lady come into reception and start polishing the numbers on some of the doors. W assumed she wouldn't be doing this unless all of the rooms were done, so we went to the back room to ask the reception staff if our 3rd room was ready - but it wasn't! Staff also tried to charge us 5 euros for wi-fi, even though it was stated as free in our confirmation and in the book in the room. In #43 the safe didn't work, the TV remote didn't work (and there was no way to change channels on the TV itself) and there was no do not disturb sign, so staff opened the door to our room twice (there was no deadbolt). While I had hot showers, my husband's turned ice cold. The breakfast was pretty good, but we had to bus a table in order to sit down and food on the buffet wasn't replaced very quickly when it ran out. However, the location is good and the church bells from across the street didn't bother me (although my husband said they woke him throughout the night).

Reviews.Title: “not as good as you'd expect from a ' 4* ' hotel”
Reviews.Author: Manilos
Reviews.Content: You should realize that somethings not right when you've booked a three star hotel but the sign outside says its a four star. We wouldn't give it a two star! This hotel is rubbish! It's not in a prime location of Amsterdam and you need to get a tram there from the station. The staff ignored us when we tried to book in and were quite obnoxious. They weren't very helpful and not pleasant at all. The room was very disappointing, as it had not been cleaned from the previous occupant. We had to empty the fridge, dispose of bathroom waste and generally tidy up. During our five day stay it wasn't cleaned once. With wall paper torn and hanging off in places it was very untidy and dusty. Breakfast was ok but nothing special. It tarnished our stay in Amsterdam as everyone else we met was friendly and provided good customer service. NOT RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “very quiet.staff helpful.Defently go back same time next year.thanks”
Reviews.Author: zena54
Reviews.Content: I zena davies went to stay in this quiet plesant place.Very close to tram line'easy to get to damsqaure and redlight district.Coffee shops within easy walk .Pepole are frendly and willing to help,..at hotel staff are equally nice ,like when i got hungery at three in the morning they made some food for me.Im hopefully going back in march,and will hopefuly stay at the omega if i can get a booking for me and my boyfriend and some mate,s.Put it this way i love amsterdam and the omega hotel staff. What more can you wont?Amsterdam is full of culture and modern day western themes for old and young alike. A must place to go and stay. C you in march omega hotel. P.S very clean and tidy family"are welcomeing.

Reviews.Title: “Omega Hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: pompeygirl86
Reviews.Content: The hotel is okay but in need of updating. We had a double room with en-suite shower/wc. This was great except that our balcony door would not close due to a faulty lock and the shower doors were broken. However, the room was very clean and comfortable. The bells on the nieighbouring church will drive you mad, chiming every half an hour all day and all night!!! Breakfast in the hotel was simple but nice. The hotel is a minute walk from the nearest tram stop which will take you straight in to the heart of Amsterdam, fantastic!! Would recommend this hotel if you are using it is as a base and not planning on spending too much time there! Absolutely fine to sleep, have breakfast and then go out for the day!! Overall, had a fab time!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware room 43!!”
Reviews.Author: misstravelbug
Reviews.Content: I read other reviews before booking, and most were ok. We were unlucky though - went for a romantic Valentine's break & found that not only was our 'double' a twin (which I know is typically European), but the beds were squeezed into a room so tiny they would only fit in an L shape with no chance of sleeping anywhere near each other... We tried to share one bed but ended with my face jammed against a wall cos the room was so cramped. On the plus side, breakfast was good (though served til 10, not 11 as advertised - late nighters beware), and location was quiet but not too far from attractions. Just stipulate that you don't want room 43 when you book!

Reviews.Title: “Great priced hotel for amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: fivelee544
Reviews.Content: Me and three friends stayed at the Omega Hotel in early september of 2006. The hotel is situated just outside the main Dam square and Leidsplien. To get to the hotel there is a tram line to Omega Hotel. Get the Tram No 2 from central station and get off at Jacob Obrechtstraat stop. The hotel is on the road behind the tram stop. The hotel rooms were fine, as were the bathroom. All rooms with TV . The only problems with the hotel, was the AC did not work and there is a church opposite the hotel, which has a bell that rings on the 1/2 hour. Did not bother us, but could affect a light sleeper. Amsterdam is an amzing city, which has so much to offer. The is a fantastic little bakery on the main road behind the hotel. The hotel also offers a great little breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: maple98
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omega Hotel for three nights. Just back yesterday. It is in a great location very close to the Museumplein (less than 10 mins). Tram into city centre to Centraal Station very close also (2-3 mins). I (female) travelled by myself and for the most part felt safe. The only thing I felt odd about the whole time I was in Amsterdam was that outside my bedroom window was a little ledge (like a balcony, but not a balcony) and also off this was a window into a room next door. I don't know if the other window belonged to a bedroom or some sort of service room but had I left my window open someone could have come from the room next door into mine. Amsterdam is experiencing a heatwave at the moment and without AC, even with the window open, it was incredibly hot and sticky in the room. My room had two beds and on the final night I changed beds in the middle of the night so sticky was it. Room was very small and would have been uncomfortable had someone been travelling with me. That said, it was clean and for the amount of time I spent in it, was fine. It cost me 65 per night but some websites were charging more. Ensuite was provided; fridge and safe in the room; breakfast included (although this seems to depend on the website you book through). Breakfast was fine - the usual fruit, cereal, bread, coffee etc and fry (although there never seemed to be any bacon). Traffic noise was non-existent at night as it is on quite a residential street. However, there is a church on the street whose clock sounds on the hour and half-hour (maybe all night?? It never actually woke me up but it would probably seriously annoy a light sleeper). There is a small but nice garden area off the bar for drinks in the evening. Encountered two receptionists - one grumpy, one nice. I don't ask for much but he could have said welcome to Amsterdam or hope you enjoyed your stay with us etc. There's a â‚¬5 charge for paying by credit card. Would stay there again. Loved Amsterdam. Top tips: (1) buy your tickets for the Van Gogh Museum and the Rijksmuseum on the web before you go. Queues are hideous. I didn't go into the Anne Frank house but walked by mid-afternoon and the queue was really long (2) wear sensible shoes - trainers etc. Mine are in bits having spent a few days in flip flops. It is a great city for walking as it's so flat (3) get out of Amsterdam and go see Haarlem (4) if the weather is good go to the beach at Zaandvort. It's on the same line as Haarlem and Amsterdam-Zaandvort is only about 30 mins. Trains from Centraal Station are so frequent you don't need to bother getting a timetable beforehand (5) Most importantly, don't walk in the cycle lane. They will run you down.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: clhimes
Reviews.Content: As a single woman I was looking for a place that was safe, clean, and quiet. Omega Hotel was all of these. My single room was tiny, but adequate. The bathroom was large and clean, shower worked well. I had a quiet room facing a courtyard and was not bothered by the church bells. The location is good, easy walk to the museums, grocery, and tramlines. Only issue was with the phone, you must give a 20 euro deposit to use the phone. I did not eat breakfast (an extra charge), but the room has a small refrigerator I stocked with snacks and drinks. I would recommend it for someone not interested in being in the center of the nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LynsayP
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel if you want to be slightly away from the madness of the Leidesplein! Very near to the museums (Van Gogh, Reijksmuseum), it is located in a very pleasant part of Amsterdam. Admittedly the guy on reception was a little surly when we checked in however our twin room (we had booked a double, must be a European thing) was very comfortable and clean, the TV and hairdryer worked and the shower was excellent! There is also a little fridge, very handy. One downside is the church opposite that chimes on the hour and half-hour - after two nights I found the chimes quite comforting! We did not have breakfast whilst we were there (10 euros), but it looked your typical continental fare - ham, cheese, rolls, coffee etc. I went downstairs to the breakfast room/bar on the Sunday morning and asked if I could take coffee and juice back to our room - the lady that was serving didn't want any money for the drinks, and she seemed quite concerned that my husband and I didn't want anything to eat - so she gave us some of those little caramel biscuits you always get with coffee in Amsterdam. Nice touch! All in all I thought this hotel was excellent value for money and I would have no hestitation in booking here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fit the Bill in Museum Area”
Reviews.Author: maisonrose
Reviews.Content: We are a retired couple and visited the Omega for five nights starting the 13th of Jan.2005. We are especially pleased with two things about the hotel: 1. They accepted our small two Bichon dogs and put us in a ground floor room where we could let them out on the terrace (not likely during the summer months, though). 2. The hotel is one block from a wonderful tram line stop Jacob Obersgraat, line 2 to Central Station. There is 1 stop to the Van Gogh Museum and 2 stops to the Rijksmuseum. Our room was small, has cable TV, a safe, an empty mini-bar where we kept some drinks. There is a small shower and adequate space for toiletries in the bathroom. The hairdryer is connected to the dresser drawer but there is no mirror near that spot. I warn Americans that suitcases can be a liability: travel light or stay in a larger hotel. The Omega has no internet connections in the rooms but for one euro per hr.you can use a desktop computer in the lobby. The PC has an English language keyboard. It works fitfully, but we did manage to get our email. There are only a few restaurants within walking distance but other shops existed: for example a tabac where the strippen karte ten-ride tram cards were sold. The best row of restaurants are along the st. facing the Concertgebouw only three blocks away. The Leidseplan (third stop from the hotel)has a plethora of eateries lining the sts. and is a center of activity in the evening. The staff friendliness and service were uneven--some clerks bent over backward, others were indifferent: the staff seemed to enjoy their work, performed any task asked of them, and refused tips. However, they were not terribly well informed about specific tourist questions (for example I asked one of the desk guys where I should go to see a major dept. store and he didn't really know). Breakfast was the usual: muesli to cheerios, breads, jams, butter, etc. A bowl of fruit cocktail was set out daily. Breakfast, served to 10 30am, included a hot section with ghastly scrambled eggs but good bacon and sausage. A limited selection of lunch meats and cheese slices rounded out the fare. Coffee, tea, hot choc. plentiful. Access (a concern to me) to the main reception was down four steps with a railing. Reception and breakfast rooms were a half story underground. The hotel is in a standard brick Amsterdam house. In the main building there is an elevator to the upper floors. Note that there is another attached house with hotel rooms: I did not notice if there was an elevator on that side, but the steps were a bit difficult to negotiate: I would not want to carry suitcases up the stairs on the far side of the DR. I advise that you mention mobility problems when booking. I would definately stay again except that the owner is concerned about keeping dogs (the maid was afraid of the dogs so we had no room cleanings).

Reviews.Title: “Not the same hotel I remembered”
Reviews.Author: Mike_Devon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on and off for about fifteen years or more, back when it was a 2 star small run and basic hotel. Since it was refurbished, extended and upgraded a few years ago, I feel it has also gained (unfortunately) the same attitudes and airs that hotels of higher stars seem to have. I recall in the 2 star days that the staff were so friendly and always remembered me and my late wife, but now, while still courteous (as all Dutch people are), there wasnt the same friendliness. The price for rooms also shot up greatly and I dont feel that there is the small value for money, given its location. I would say that the hotel was more 3 star than 4, and that you could find better value elsewhere, but one of the attractions is the sheer quirkiness of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelbaLalala
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omega hotel in September '05. I was worried about it because there wasnt alot of information out there about the hotel. We were pleasantly surprised. The downsides: On the website we booked the hotel at hotelres the Omega boasted that breakfast was until 11am but it ended at 10. <We are not early people>. They forced us to pre-pay for the room as soon as we checked in which I had never experienced before. And, it was a LITTLE further from Central Amsterdam than I had thought. The pros: Pretty clean <though there was a weird smell near the curtains>, the layout of the room was cool because the bathroom and sleeping area were separated by a couple of steps. It was a nice quiet area, and the tram couldnt be closer. The A/C was nice as it was warm out. Given the price (80 Euros a night) I would stay there again, but might consider paying a little more to stay closer to the action (as the trams close at midnight).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good atmoshphere”
Reviews.Author: debsi
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in September at the Omega. We arrived late and were greeted really graciously by Sophie, who forewarned us about the church bells. They did not bother us in the least. We had a large room on a low floor. The room had air conditioning which was absolutely terrific since it was 33C outdoors. (Our only complaint is that the fridge was not cleaned out, it may have been missed.) There was a lovely garden and we were invited to tea or coffee the entire stay. The front desk people were exceptionally helpful and printed out train and other schedules for us. The hotel is in a residential area and quite central. Wonderful Vondelpark is a 2 minute walk away and the Van Gogh museum is 5 minutes away. It was quite a difference staying in a quiet area as opposed to a larger hotel near all the action in the center. The 2 tram is a 5 minute ride from Leidesplein. We would definitely recommend this hotel and go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: neepz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights last month. Hotel is in a good location, just minutes away from van gogh museum and the leidseplein, and on a quiet residential street. Good base for sightseeing. Room was clean and a good size with a balcony, mini-bar was empty though. Can't understand other peoples reviews regarding the staff at this hotel though. Any time we approached them they were acting as though we were bothering them and interupting there tv viewing. They never said hello when you entered reception and i never saw a smile once. We asked at the reception to have some drinks at the bar one evening (reception staff also cover the small bar) and we felt we were really hassling him as he was obviously very busy (watching tv in back room at reception!). If it wasn't for the attitudes of staff i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An odd little hotel”
Reviews.Author: colmirl
Reviews.Content: I wish I could give this hotel 3 and 1/2 stars, because I think 4 is just a little too much for it. It has some very good points - it is very accessible via the 2 or 16 trams from Centraal Station, and bus. It's near enough to Amsterdam city centre to be easily travelled, but far enough away to give you a chance to escape the hustle and bustle. It is located in a quiet residential area, yet is close to the Museumplein. It's also very close to the local (underground!) Albert Heijn supermarket so you can pick up soft drinks, sandwiches etc to avoid playing hotel prices. The room was clean and comfortable as was the bathroom. Now for the bad points - the reception staff were very dour and unwelcoming. Housekeeping seemed "dodgy" at best. One day they left no new toilet paper in my room (despite there only being a little left on the roll) - when I went to reception and asked for more, it was played out like it was a major imposition on their time with a lot of tutting and list checking! Another day, I returned to the hotel and found Housekeeping had left my room door open when they finished cleaning the room! Thankfully nothing was taken, but I was annoyed. All in all, it's a reasonable hotel if you just want basic accomodation. However, I would not expect too much from it either. Location wise it can't be beat - service wise though, it can. Would have hoped for better from a Ramada!

Reviews.Title: “Location Great, Accomadation Good”
Reviews.Author: Leddin
Reviews.Content: Near the Central train station and aside streetcar stop. OK so the room was small, but well laid out and a good bathroom...well serviced. Folks at the front desk were great. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: marrakesh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, The rooms were lovely, clean and well kept. Staff were very accomodating. The location is ideal for a short break in the city. 5 min walk from the rail station, and great for expolring. From experience I'd say its worth paying the extra to stay in a 3* rather than 2* in Amsterdam!!

HotelInfo.Name: Omega Hotel Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Jacob Obrechtstraat 33, Museum Quarter, Amsterdam 1071 KG, The Netherlands
